fields.subtitle: Project: Oxford Gardens Retirement Home
fields.title: Seniors Buildings
fields.content:
## Specifications:

150,000 square feet, 120 Units
HVAC System - Solar assisted heating and cooling system

## Challenge:

Engineer a solar energy system capable of powering air conditioning.

## Solution:

EMCAD participated in a groundbreaking pilot program sponsored by the Canadian federal government and partially funded with German solar power incentives. State-of-art solar tube collectors were installed on the roof to generate energy for building air conditioning and heating, domestic hot water and pool heating.
fields.blurb:
EMCAD provided design and construction services to Oxford Gardens Retirement Home - a complete renovation/conversion of a 200-room nursing home into a 120-suite resort style independent living community.

A ground-breaking solar energy pilot program.

fields.subtitle: Project: Gainsborough Seniors Residence
fields.title: Low-Rise
fields.content:
## Specifications:

4 floors -120 Units

## Challenge:

EMCAD was contracted to design an HVAC system suited to very tight utility spaces. The client wanted to preserve the look of the exterior facade and did not want any air conditioning units on the ground or on the exterior walls.

## Solution:

EMCAD designed a system featuring a combination hot water and space heating system with a hot water tanks powered by natural gas in every suite, saving energy and space.  EMCAD also engineered an aesthetically pleasing air-conditioning system. Cooling units were placed on the roof of the fourth floor, hidden from view.
fields.blurb:
EMCAD provided design and construction services to the Gainsborough Seniors Residence - a four-floor 120-unit adult community complex.

An aesthetically pleasing HVAC system designed to fit very tight utility spaces.

fields.subtitle: Project: The West Village Student Condominium Project
fields.title: Go Green
fields.content:
Read more about it in Building Strategies (PDF).

## Specifications:

9 Stories, 108 Units

## Challenge:

From solar energy, to waste water management and energy conservation, our client wanted to adopt the best ideas to achieve Platinum LEED certification.

## Solution:
Solar Domestic Hot Water Heating System
Storm water collected in a cistern then used for a grey water system to all toilets and sprinkler systems
Energy Recovery Units for all building ventilation systems
Motion detectors to control common area lighting
Each residential unit has an “All Off” switch at the entrance to shut off all non-essential power loads when the resident exits

EMCAD is now working on our second LEED building for the same client.
fields.blurb:
EMCAD provided complete design and construction services to the West Village Student Condominium Project - this building achieved the highest rating possible in North America for environmental design and energy efficiency (LEED Platinum).

The best ideas for LEED certification.

fields.subtitle: Project: Goodlife Fitness Centres
fields.title: Retrofit
fields.content:
## Challenge:

Retrofit electrical and mechanical systems appropriate for a fitness club into existing retail spaces ranging in size from 15,000 to 70,000 
square feet.     

## Solution:

Fitness clubs place a high demand on ventilation air and domestic water. Retrofitting a new occupancy to a building’s existing electrical and mechanical services is very challenging and requires intensive preparatory fieldwork.
fields.blurb:
EMCAD has provided complete design and reconstruction services to 44 Goodlife Fitness Centres retrofit and new building projects across Canada.

Refitting today’s HVAC systems into yesterday’s structures.

fields.subtitle: Project: Shanghai Links Executive Residences
fields.title: Shanghai Links
fields.content:
## Specifications:

* 50 residential houses and a golf clubhouse
* Self-contained infrastructure for sewage and water treatment, storm water, electricity, television and telephone systems.

## Challenge:

Build a complete Canadian-style housing community on a piece of recovered ocean land for Canadian-expatriates working for Shell, GM and Dupont, in Pudong, Shanghai.

## Solution:

EMCAD assumed complete responsibility for electrical and mechanical design and construction support for the project. Canadian house designs were adapted to Shanghai’s hotter climate with more powerful air conditioning and dehumidification units. The client wanted to use Canadian trades on the project and contracted EMCAD to hire Canadian mechanical and electrical trades and supervise their work in China.
fields.blurb:
EMCAD provided complete electrical, mechanical design and construction support to the construction of Shanghai Links Golf and Country Club – a unique Canadian-style executive community in Pudong, Shanghai.

Bringing Canadian inspiration know-how to Shanghai.

fields.subtitle: Project: The Cobble Beach Golf Links Golf & Country Club
fields.title: Golf Club House
fields.content:
## Specifications:

* 32,000 square foot Golf Club House and Inn
* HVAC System – 50-Ton Geothermal System

## Challenge:

This spectacular, award-winning Nantucket-style clubhouse features an open main floor, wraparound terrace, a bar, four-season rooms, a 
ten-suite luxury inn and a spa. It has the design features of a house, with the electrical, mechanical needs of a commercial building. The client did not want the stunning architecture compromised by electrical and mechanical ductwork and equipment.

## Solution:

EMCAD Consulting Engineers designed a unique electrical and mechanical system largely hidden from view. Instead of putting air conditioning on the ground or the roof, EMCAD adapted a geothermal system. Heating and cooling are provided by a geothermal loop into the pond next to the clubhouse.  An energy recovery ventilation system supplies energy efficient indoor air.

EMCAD also designed innovative ways to hide ductwork, such as building a loft for some equipment, and moving fan coils into the basement.
fields.blurb:
EMCAD provided design and construction services to Cobble Beach Golf Links, a Golf & Country Club in Owen Sound, Ontario.

The architectural features of a house, with the electrical, mechanical needs of a commercial building.
